div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre:
1708 Keneh (mod. Qena; anc. Kaiono- (545) polis), near Luxor, 1923 Burial: c. 144 B.C. Contents: 45+ AV, 200 AR Ptolemy VI: 43 AV octadr. (Alexandreia 43, Cyprus?) ANS 1967.152.683 2 AV tetradr. (Alexandreia) ANS 1967.152.682 191 AR tetradr. (Alexandreia 190, Paphus 1) ANS 1944.100.78713 ANS 1944.100.78715 ANS 1944.100.78726 ANS 1944.100.78728 ANS 1944.100.78722 ANS 1944.100.78719 ANS 1944.100.78720 ANS 1944.100.78772
Ptolemy VII Eupator: 1 AR tetradr. (Alex- andreia) ANS 1944.100.78775
Ptolemy VIII: 4 AR tetradr. (Alexandreia) ANS 1944.100.78902 ANS 1944.100.78906 ANS 1944.100.78904 ANS 1944.100.78905 Disposition: New York 15; Florange-Ciani Oct. 16, 1923, pl. 3, 63-5, 73-82 Newell, NNM 33 (1927), pp. 14-31, illus. (Ptole- my VIII tetradr. given as Paphus, p. 22, but Newell later regarded these as of Alexandreia, see Standard Ptol. Silver, p. 11
